title: Gargantuaskin treasure locations in FFXIV: Dawntrail
description: Time to spin slots in Vault Oneiron
content:
Gargantuaskin maps are the second set of treasure maps to hit FFXIV: Dawntrail, allowing you to party up with your buddies and try your luck to get exclusive prizes. You'll need to decipher your Timeworn Gargantuaskin Map, find where the map points you, and you'll get a chance to find the new treasure dungeon: Vault Oneiron.

This dungeon notably drops the rare Mini Yan and Gimme Kitten minions, and the highly sought-after Yan Horn, which will give you the Yan mount. You'll have to get pretty lucky in Vault Oneiron to get your mitts on this loot, though.

Below we explain where to find Timeworn Gargantuaskin Maps in Final Fantasy 14 and where to find the treasure after you crack that map.

Where to get Timeworn Gargantuaskin Maps in FFXIV: Dawntrail

You can grab these maps randomly from any of the level 100 gathering nodes in Living Memory. The map will show up somewhat randomly, so note that it might take a few nodes before you strike one with a map. I personally like teleporting to Leynode Pyro, as there's mining outcrops that drop maps right next to the aetheryte. As a reminder, you can only dig up a map once every 18 hours.

You can also buy maps from the marketboard, but beware! Map prices can get really high depending on where we are in the patch cycle and what items were added to the rewards pool.

Once you get your map, you can select to decipher it, which will make a little square of map show up on your screen with a red "x" on it. You'll need to head to this location and use the "dig" action to get to your chest. Make sure you're partied up with some pals, as interacting with the chest will spawn enemies, and if you're lucky, a portal into Vault Oneiron. Unlike Br'aaxskin Treasure Maps, these maps will always lead you to Living Memory.

As previously mentioned, all Gargantuaskin maps will take you to Living Memory, the final Dawntrail zone. Using our map below, you should be able to look at the little sliver of map that the game gives you and align it to its correct spot.
summary: Gargantuaskin maps are the second set of treasure maps to hit FFXIV: Dawntrail, allowing players to party up with their friends and find exclusive prizes in the game. These maps can be found randomly from any level 100 gathering nodes in Living Memory. Once you decipher one map, you will be able to find the new treasure dungeon: Vault Oneiron, which drops rare Mini Yan and Gimme Kitten minions and the highly sought-after Yan Horn. However, you can only dig up a map once every 18 hours and prices can vary depending on where the map is located. All Gargantuasksin maps will always lead you to Living Memory, the final Dawntra zone.
shortSummary: Timeworn Gargantuaskin Maps in FFXIV: Dawntrail offer unique treasure hunts and can be found in Vault Oneiron, offering exclusive prizes like Mini Yan and Yan Horn.

Final Fantasy 14’s treasure dungeons are a fun party experience and a great way to make gil and the Dawntrail expansion’s br’aaxskin maps are no exception. Once you use your Timeworn Br’aaxskin Map, you’ll need to find the treasure on one of the five available maps.
As usual, completing these treasure hunts with friends is a great way to grab gil and tomestones, as well as exclusive glamour materials, minions, and even currency to unlock special mounts. Lucky players will also enter portals to the Cenote Ja Ja Gural dungeon for even more loot.
Below we explain where to find Timeworm Br’aaxskin Maps in Final Fantasy XIV and the treasure locations are once you crack that map.
Where to get Timeworn Br’aaxskin Maps in FFXIV Dawntrail
You can grab br’aaxskin maps from almost any of the level 100 gathering nodes in Dawntrail. Our favorite node to grab them from is the logging nodes that spawn a bit south of the Mehwahhetsoan aetheryte in Shaaloani because it’s so close by and easy to grab.
Once you decipher the map, a little square of one of the five Dawntrail zones will show up, with a red x marking the location of the treasure. (There are no dig spots in Living Memory for these maps. It’s likely that another treasure map will launch later for this zone, similarly to how ophiotauroskin maps launched during Endwalker.) You’ll need to dig near the x to find the treasure.
With luck, a portal will pop and lead you and your party to a portal, putting you in the Cenote Ja Ja Gural dungeon. Sometimes you’ll dig up treasure but you won’t open a portal to the cenote. Unlucky. :(
You may want flying unlocked (via aether currents) in each of the zones before you set off for the sake of ease, but it’s not mandatory. You can always ask a party member to caddy you around in a multi-person mount, too.
Br’aaxskin treasure locations
Below we mark all the known treasure locations for br’aaxskin maps. You should be able to look at your little map sliver and match it up with one of ours, which have been approximately replicated. (They’re not 100% exact, but they are extremely close.)
Kozama’uka treasure locations
The dig spots for Kozama’uka are pretty spread out around the map, so you’ll likely want to make use of all the aetherytes.
Urqopacha treasure locations
Most of the dig spots for Urqopacha are on the southern half of the map, making for a mostly easy search.
Yak T’el treasure locations
A lot of the Yak T’el dig spots are on the edges of the map, making them a far trek from the aetherytes, unfortunately.
Shaaloani treasure locations
Shaaloani’s flat map can make it hard to spot where your dig spot is, since there aren’t many landmarks provided in your given map slices, so make sure to look for the text and small ridges.
Heritage Found treasure locations
While spread out, most of Heritage Found’s dig spots are pretty discernible.
If you’re just starting out in the massive world of Final Fantasy 14, we have tons of guides to help you. We have a beginner’s guide to get you started, along with guides detailing when you’ll get your mount and which Grand Company you should join.
If you’re starting but are feeling overwhelmed, we have guides to help with picking a job and a guide that explains how long it may take to catch up to current content in FFXIV.
We also have guides on side content, like ocean fishing, relic weapons, and Island Sanctuary, for those who want to take a break from it all.

argos_summary: Gargantuaskin maps are a new feature in FFXIV: Dawntrail, allowing players to team up and hunt for treasures in the Vault Oneiron dungeon, which offers exclusive rewards like the Mini Yan minion and Yan mount. Players can obtain Timeworn Gargantuaskin Maps from level 100 gathering nodes or purchase them from the marketboard, and must decipher the maps to locate treasure chests that may lead to the dungeon. The treasure hunts are designed for cooperative play, enhancing the experience of exploring the game.
